column4: hello all... i run windows and linux on this system .... windows seems to work fairly fast (this is a pentium M 1.7 ghz)... linux doesn't work as fast as it should... what could i be doing wrong
did u install drivers for your hardware on your computer?
for linux... no i didn't
everything works fine... but when i browse the web.. it's kinda slow
im running a dsl up to 3.0mbps
john_frca, is ur internet running slow, or the browser (as in system performance)
welll the browser isnt as responsive
dsl reports show speeds that are fairly high
the reason windows is running faster is b/c the drivers are telling windows how to use the hardware, while in Linux, generic drivers can not take advantage of your hardware
how do i fix that silentread???
what type of graphics card do you have?
it's an integrated intel card
what i would recommend is that you search if your hardware vendor for your graphics card makes a linux version of its driver, if so I would recommnend installing that
its a dell inspiron... ive checked their site.. they don't list anything
how much ram do you have?
it takes forever changing from one webpage to another
hmmm. does your browser lock up?
not at all
so how do you know its not your internet connection?
i know it's not my internet connection,... i get 3.0mbps with windows
i was just downloading with linux at 900 kbps
which should be pretty good
hmm. im srry, i dont know then
